name: Scroll Progress
author: WorBee

sections.description: Displays a horizontal progress bar that shows a scroll position relative to the height of the opened page. Useful for websites with longer articles. Developed by worbee.com
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
sections.changelog:
1.3.2

  • further improvements on translations
  • support WordPress 5.5
  • reverse sorted this Changelog
  • small copy edits

1.3.1

  • removed translations from plugin source, will be handled via translate.wordpress.org
  • now using correct slug for translation domain

1.3

  • plugin is now translation ready
  • added English (USA) and Bulgarian language packs

1.2

  • added option to show/hide the progress slider’s leading point
  • added option to move the progress slider to the top
  • switched the slider to use the height of the whole page, and no longer trying to determine the height of the content only
  • made settings variable more unique
  • fixed scroll progress value for when we are in the last scroll of window height
  • added plugin version to assets, to invalidate caches

1.1.5

  • updated compatibility

1.1.4

  • updated URL

1.1.3

  • moved slider down, so it’s only visible 50%; removed border-radius on the slider

1.1.2

  • updated plugin logic on scrolled length
  • completed admin page for color customisation of the slider
  • lowered delay between slider updates

1.1

  • improved slider position. It now takes into account the bottom of the window as well
  • added admin page to configure the color of the slider
